subject: Career
title: The Tone Gap in Text
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Tone Gap in Text.

hook.text: 'Fine.' Is that angry? Agreeable? Passive-aggressive? In text, tone is the reader's guess.

buildup.text: Without vocal tone and body language, written messages lose 93% of their emotional signal.

discovery.text: Research shows people interpret neutral emails as slightly negative. Positivity must be added deliberately.

twist.text: Exclamation points and emoji aren't unprofessional â€” they fill the tone gap that text creates.

climax.text: When in doubt, be warmer than you think necessary. 'Thanks!' is better than 'Thanks.' in almost every context.

punchline.text: In text, silence reads as cold. Warmth must be written.

quiz.question: How do people tend to interpret neutral-toned emails?
